intro: Eriostemon taraxacifolius, commonly known as the dandelion tree, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, dandelion-like leaves that are deeply lobed and covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by fluffy, white seed heads. It thrives in coastal and sandy soils, often found in coastal heathlands and open woodlands. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
